author: Rob Sabo
description: The steelmakers plan to modernize and expand steel production at major facilities in Indiana and Pennsylvania and create more than 100,000 jobs.
title: US Steel, Nippon Steel Announce $11 Billion Investment Over 3 Years

author: Olivia Gomm
description: An Ontario judge has sentenced two Indian immigrants to house arrest for two years less a day after they ran truck driving schools that didn’t offer entry-level students the minimum required training. Ontario Superior Court Justice Pierre Roger called the fraudulent driving schools “an elaborate scheme,” which involved nearly 100 truck driver students over two […]
title: Immigrants on House Arrest for Running Fraudulent Truck Driving Schools in Ontario

author: Jennifer Li
description: The United States and Western allies are working to establish a rare earth supply chain to counter China’s monopoly.
title: Post-China Rare Earth Monopoly Era Is Approaching as Beijing’s Strategy Backfires: Experts

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: B.C. Premier David Eby and coastal First Nations have signed a declaration asking Ottawa to keep the oil tanker ban on the province’s north coast in place. Eby said at a Nov. 5 press conference that lifting the oil tanker ban, a federal law prohibiting oil tankers on B.C.’s northern coast, would expose the region […]
title: BC Premier, Coastal First Nations Sign Declaration Urging Feds to Maintain Tanker Ban

author: Matthew Horwood
description: The Crown has filed appeals against the sentencing and acquittals of intimidation charges for Freedom Convoy organizers Tamara Lich and Chris Barber. The development comes a day after Lich’s lawyers filed a notice of appeal for her mischief conviction in the Ontario Court of Appeal on Nov. 4. Lich and Barber were both found guilty […]
title: Crown Files Appeal Against Sentencing, Acquittals of Freedom Convoy Organizers Lich and Barber

author: Matthew Horwood
description: The Liberal government introduced a tax on high-end vehicles, yachts, and private aircraft in 2022, but Prime Minister Mark Carney’s newly released federal budget now proposes its removal. Budget 2025 would get rid of the luxury tax on aircraft valued at more than $100,000 and boats valued at more than $250,000, but appears to leave […]
title: Trudeau-Era Luxury Tax Slashed in Budget 2025

author: The Canadian Press
description: The federal budget says Canada will take out equity stakes in critical mineral projects to open up mining and position Canada as a major global supplier. The federal budget, released Tuesday in Ottawa, outlines a plan for a $2 billion “critical minerals sovereign fund” over five years for equity investments, loan guarantees and offtake agreements. […]
title: Feds Pitch $2B Fund for Critical Minerals Investments, Including Equity Stakes

author: Rachel Roberts
description: Poland, Hungary, and Slovakia voted against the agreement to reduce emissions by 90 percent by 2040 amid a growing backlash against Net Zero policies.
title: EU Agrees Softer Carbon Emissions Target Ahead of Brazil Summit

author: The Canadian Press
description: Toronto’s real estate board says home sales and prices were down in October from a year earlier as economic uncertainty persists. The Toronto Regional Real Estate Board said home sales totalled 6,138, down 9.5 percent from last year. On a seasonally adjusted basis, the GTA saw a 2.3 percent drop in sales from September. The […]
title: Greater Toronto Home Sales Down 9.5 Percent in October From Last Year

author: Reuters
description: TORONTO—Canada’s services economy expanded in October for the first time in 11 months as businesses showed signs of adjusting to economic uncertainty, S&P Global’s Canada services PMI data showed on Wednesday. The headline Business Activity Index rose to 50.5 last month from 46.3 in September, posting its first move above the 50 threshold since November […]
title: Canada’s October Services PMI Shows First Expansion in the Sector This Year

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: The Liberal government’s newly released budget is proposing several cuts to Immigration Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC) to realize 15 percent savings over the next three fiscal years. Tabled on Nov. 4, Prime Minister Mark Carney’s budget aims to implement a 65 percent reduction in the issuance of international student permits for 2026, alongside a […]
title: Budget 2025 Cuts International Student Permits by 65%, Reduces Immigration Funding

author: Rachel Roberts
description: The UK government expects answers after a leaked report said the corporation edited a speech to make it appear Trump encouraged violence at the U.S. Capitol.
title: Leaked Report Alleges BBC Misled Viewers in Editing of Trump’s Jan. 6 Speech

author: The Canadian Press
description: The Liberal government says it will restore a privacy provision from the Online Streaming Act that was accidentally deleted. The federal budget released this week says the government will make a legislative amendment to add back the privacy provision. In 2023, the Online Streaming Act updated Canada’s Broadcasting Act to capture online streamers like Netflix. […]
title: Ottawa to Restore Accidentally Deleted Privacy Provision in Streaming Bill

author: Guy Birchall
description: The government in Paris suspended access to the Chinese retailer amid a scandal over childlike sex dolls being listed on its website.
title: France Suspends Online Access to Shein as Retailer Opens First Store in Paris

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: The organization came under scrutiny after a 2024 rally in Hamburg calling for the creation of an Islamic caliphate.
title: Germany Bans Activist Group Muslim Interaktiv

author: The Canadian Press
description: A British Columbia regulator has ordered Amazon to pay a $10,000 penalty over a failed delivery, ruling that it’s not good enough to leave a package on a doorstep or with another person unless the buyer consents. Consumer Protection BC says in a decision issued last month that the consumer complained to them that Amazon […]
title: BC Regulator Fines Amazon $10,000 in Ruling That Limits What ‘Delivery’ Means

author: Chandra Philip
description: Incidents of family violence against Canadian seniors has hit a record high, according to data from Statistics Canada. The recently released StatCan report found that the number of seniors mistreated by a family member has risen 49 percent since 2018. StatCan analyzed police-reported incidents of family violence nationwide for the study. Seniors were most often […]
title: Family Violence Against Seniors in Canada Reaches Record High: StatCan

author: Noé Chartier
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney welcomed former Tory MP Chris d’Entremont in joining the Liberal caucus at an event they both attended in Ottawa. “Chris’s decision to join the government caucus at this crucial moment for our country is exceptionally valuable, important,” Carney said during a Nov. 5 press conference related to his recently tabled budget. […]
title: Carney Says MP d’Entremont Joining Liberals Is ‘Exceptionally Valuable’

author: Guy Birchall
description: More than 100 bear attacks have occurred this year, resulting in a total of 13 fatalities so far.
title: Japan Sends Troops to Combat Spike in Fatal Bear Attacks

author: Olivia Gomm
description: The Liberal government’s 2025 budget is proposing to provide more than $81 billion over five years to build up the Canadian Armed Forces (CAF), as Canada works towards meeting NATO’s defence spending target of 5 percent of GDP by 2035. Finance Minister François-Philippe Champagne tabled the Carney government’s first budget on Nov. 4, projecting a […]
title: Budget 2025 Includes $81B in Funding Aiming to Bolster the Canadian Military

author: Victoria Friedman
description: In Ukraine's report, the EU said Kyiv has shown 'remarkable resilience and strong commitment to its European path.'
title: New Countries Joining EU by 2030 a Realistic Goal, EU Foreign Policy Chief Says

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Nearly 13 percent of Ontario patients connected to a family physician need to travel more than 30 kilometres for their appointments, a newly released study says. The study published in the Canadian Medical Association Journal tracked nearly 10 million Ontario residents living in urban and suburban areas who were registered with a family physician as […]
title: More Than 1.2M Ontarians Travel At Least 30 Kilometres for Family Doctor Appointments: Report

author: Dorothy Li
description: North Korean cybercriminals have pilfered more than $3 billion, mostly in cryptocurrency, over the past three years, the Treasury estimated.
title: US Sanctions North Korean Bankers, Institutions Over Money Laundering

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: Arab League Secretary-General Ahmed Aboul Gheit called for urgent action to protect civilians and to end the violence.
title: US Working With Arab Partners to End Sudan Conflict, White House Says

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: British Columbia and Saskatchewan authorities are investigating multiple reports of sewing needles or pins discovered in candy distributed to children on Halloween. Police in Kamloops, Rossland, Delta, Prince George, and Surrey in British Columbia and the Regina Police Service in Saskatchewan have issued advisories warning parents to check all Halloween treats collected on Oct. 31 […]
title: Police in BC, Saskatchewan Investigating Reports of Needles Found in Halloween Candy

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: Authorities say a 35-year-old man was arrested after a deliberate car-ramming attack on Ile d'Oleron island.

description: The investigation follows a lawsuit against the company by French parents and a probe conducted by the nation's parliament.
title: Paris Prosecutors Investigate TikTok Over Youth Suicide Content

author: The Canadian Press
description: Canada’s top bureaucrat is warning the budget’s spending reduction target is a “big number” that will mean cuts to programs and jobs in the public service. Tuesday’s federal budget outlined a plan to lower program spending and administration costs by about $60 billion over the next five years. In a message sent to federal employees […]
title: Head of Public Service Says Programs, Staff Will Be Cut as Government Seeks Savings

author: Victoria Friedman
description: Belgium’s security minister said he has asked the prime minister to convene a meeting of the National Security Council.
title: Belgian Airports Closed Due to Drone Sightings

description: The Pentagon said earlier that the United States and its coalition partners would be reducing their military mission in Iraq.
title: Iraq Now Capable of Conducting Independent Airstrikes: US Centcom

description: The body of an IDF staff sergeant, who was an American Israeli dual citizen, was returned to Israel. There remain seven hostage bodies still missing for Israel.

description: The plan comes as Ahmed al-Sharaa prepares to meet President Donald Trump at the White House next week.

description: Housing Minister O’Neil says boom reflects decades-long affordability crisis, vows new data to rebut claims scheme turbocharged prices.

author: PA Media
description: Bosses at Sizewell C have said the major nuclear project is “on budget and on schedule” after securing its necessary financing. The planned nuclear power plant reached financial close on Tuesday, indicating that all necessary funding will now be able to flow into the major infrastructure project. Sizewell C concluded an equity raise this summer […]
title: Sizewell C ‘On Budget and on Schedule’ as Financing Completes

author: PA Media
description: Treasury ministers have stood by the decision to bring farms into inheritance tax next year. Exchequer Secretary Dan Tomlinson said the Government made “the right decision” at last year’s budget to end a full tax relief for farmers, when they pass on agricultural property. From April 2026, farm landowners will pay inheritance tax at an […]
title: Treasury Ministers Stand by Farm Tax Plan

author: PA Media
description: Tommy Robinson has been cleared of a terror offence after refusing to give police his phone Pin when he was stopped at the border in a Bentley with thousands of pounds in cash. Robinson, 42, whose real name is Stephen Yaxley-Lennon, was driving a silver Bentayga SUV to the Spanish tourist hotspot of Benidorm when […]
title: Tommy Robinson Cleared of Terror Offence After Being Stopped Driving Bentley

author: PA Media
description: Rachel Reeves has warned millions of Britons they could face higher taxes because “we will all have to contribute” to securing the country’s economic future. Ahead of the November 26 Budget, the Chancellor would not commit to maintaining Labour’s manifesto promises not to raise income tax, national insurance or VAT, fuelling speculation. She blamed global […]
title: Reeves Puts Country on Notice for Tax Hikes as ‘Each of US Must Do Our Bit’

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Burgess says Beijing remains firmly in focus of the intelligence agency.
title: ASIO Chief Puts CCP on Notice in Foreign Interference Warning

description: Minister for Defence Industry Pat Conroy spoke about Australia's acquisition of new military hardware to deal with potential threats from the CCP.
title: Defence Industry Minister Says ‘Bravery’ and Speed Needed in Military Build-Up

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Ontario Premier Doug Ford says trade negotiations with the United States are the responsibility of the federal government, which aligns with similar comments made by Prime Minister Mark Carney after Ontario’s anti-tariff advertising campaign led U.S. President Donald Trump to stop trade negotiations with Canada. “He is the prime minister. I’m the premier. When it […]
title: Ontario’s Ford Acknowledges Trade Talk ‘Falls on’ Federal Government Following Anti-Tariff Ad Controversy

author: Riley Donovan
description: Commentary Amidst the fanfare of Tuesday’s dramatic budget announcement, the federal government’s first three-year Immigration Levels Plan has thus far received comparatively little attention–despite being included inside the budget itself (usually, the Levels Plan is released as a stand-alone announcement). On page 95 of the 406-page budget, we find the 2026-2028 Immigration Levels Plan. It […]
title: While Ottawa’s Budget Cuts Temporary Resident Numbers, Permanent Immigration Targets Rise

author: Aldgra Fredly
description: This marked the 16th reported U.S. military strike against drug smuggling vessels since September.
title: 2 Killed in US Military Strike on Drug Smuggling Boat in Pacific: Hegseth

author: Olivia Gomm
description: The Conservatives and the Bloc Québécois say they won’t support the 2025 budget presented by the Liberal government on Nov. 4, while the NDP says it will study and consult further before making a decision. Federal Finance Minister François-Philippe Champagne tabled the first budget under Prime Minister Mark Carney, projecting a deficit of $78.3 billion […]
title: Conservatives, Bloc Say They’ll Vote Against Liberals’ Budget, NDP Undecided

description: The ASIO chief warned of a 'realistic possibility' a foreign government could attempt to assassinate a dissident on Australian soil.
title: ASIO Warns 3 Foreign States Poised for ‘Lethal Targeting’ in Australia

author: Matthew Horwood
description: The Carney government tabled its highly anticipated budget on Nov. 4, putting to the test whether it can secure enough opposition support to survive a confidence vote. So far, the Conservatives and the Bloc Québécois have said they won’t support the budget, while the NDP has said it needs more time before making a decision. […]

author: Chandra Philip
description: Chrysler is recalling more than 20,000 Jeep vehicles in Canada over concerns of a faulty battery that can catch on fire even when the vehicle is not running. The recall applies to 20,753 Canadian plug-in hybrid electric vehicles, according to Transport Canada. The vehicles impacted include Jeep Wranglers from 2021 to 2025, and Grand Cherokees […]
title: Chrysler Recalls 20,000 Jeep Hybrid Vehicles Over Battery Fire Concerns

description: 'This is a dynamic list and will always change,' eSafety Commissioner Julie Inman Grant said.
title: Reddit and Kick Added to Australia’s Social Media Ban for Under 16s

author: Omid Ghoreishi
description: Nova Scotia MP Chris d’Entremont has left the Conservative caucus to join the governing Liberals, saying he wants to support the Liberal government’s budget. “After serious consideration and thoughtful conversations with constituents and my family, I came to a clear conclusion: there is a better path forward for our country — and a better path […]
title: NS MP d’Entremont Leaves Conservative Caucus to Join the Liberals

author: Monica O’Shea
description: Attorney General Kyam Maher warned about the dark side of AI.
title: Using AI to Create Humiliating Deepfakes Could Lead to 4 Years in Jail in SA

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney’s first budget tabled on Nov. 4 forecasts $2.7 billion in cuts to foreign aid over the next four years. The budget predicts $561 million in cost reductions next fiscal year for Global Affairs Canada (GAC), rising to $1.1 billion per year of projected savings within two years, saying that Canada’s foreign […]
title: 2025 Budget Slashes Foreign Aid by $2.7 Billion Over Next Four Years
